channel.title: RAIDING (if new plugin is installed) (added a better example)
channel.description:
more realistic aswell
Better example [img]http://i.picasion.com/pic42/4694cf4ae2a361f3a3d7478c9d9e787a.gif[/img]
just push the city walls with pistons. or pull them out... and break in that way. its easy to find away around city walls.

item.title: RAIDING (if new plugin is installed) (added a better example)
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

As I think Tom said, the plugin would also protect against any shenanigans with pistons, and if it didn’t, it would be a bug.

Read full topic
item.source: RAIDING (if new plugin is installed) (added a better example)

item.title: RAIDING (if new plugin is installed) (added a better example)
item.dc:creator: @PLayRooney PLayRooney
item.description:
@PLayRooney wrote:

a = lever
| = the surronded area
x = pistion

I’ll try and do this as good as i can.

axxxxxxxx|

you would then push the lever this would cause this;

a xxxxxxx|x

Then you would break the lever and the piston at the start of the line and replace them closer to the next piston so when you hit the lever you placed 1 block up it would cause

axxxxxxx|xx

I highly doubt i explained this right but eh…

Read full topic
item.source: RAIDING (if new plugin is installed) (added a better example)

item.title: RAIDING (if new plugin is installed) (added a better example)
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

[quote=“PLayRooney, post:47, topic:402013”]you make a train of pistons out side of the protected area, you use 1 lever at the very end. hit the lever so they all move up one, the break the last piston and lever and move them on block up, this will require alot of pistons but it would work[/quote]You would have to make a picture of it cause I haven’t got a clue on what you mean.

Read full topic

@PLayRooney wrote:

you make a train of pistons out side of the protected area, you use 1 lever at the very end. hit the lever so they all move up one, the break the last piston and lever and move them on block up, this will require alot of pistons but it would work

[quote=“PLayRooney, post:45, topic:402013”]What if i put pistons outside of there protected area then kept using more pistons to move the first pistons closer to the wall?[/quote]Well how would you place the redstone to make them work?

item.title: RAIDING (if new plugin is installed) (added a better example)
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“mironic, post:43, topic:402013”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=499067.msg3652813#msg3652813 date=1309837032]
No, just 13 extra spots open, so a 51x51 wall.
[/quote]
if you can face the wall and plant one… you can use the pistons.[/quote]Are you trolling? If you have a protected 64x64 area with a 51x51 wall, pistons can’t be placed in the area surrounding the wall.

Read full topic

item.source: RAIDING (if new plugin is installed) (added a better example)

item.title: RAIDING (if new plugin is installed) (added a better example)
item.dc:creator: @mironic mironic
item.description:
@mironic wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:40, topic:402013”][quote author=mironic link=topic=499067.msg3652700#msg3652700 date=1309832378]

How about we all just end the discussion and get back on topic?

OT: I don’t think pistons would be allowed to push blocks, if they where that would be a major flaw.

excatly, unless there is a plugin that can disable pistons then that would be the only way… but to get pistons you would have to play the game awhile… or just ask a friend lolz

I think Tom is saying that if Residence plugin was set to not allow other users to edit blocks, it wouldn’t allow other user’s pistons to edit blocks either.

naw, the pistons code is not editing though its moving/pushing. aka temp gravity. (looked at the code… its pretty lazy…)
when the stick pistion retracts it just reverses gravity. thats why they dont have there sticky property when there retracted there not actually sticky but gravity modifiers for that block…

You would never be able to place the piston there without mining out that spot, so this entire method is completely unusable.

? da fuck ? you talking about? O-o yes you would… you dont need to mine a spot to place a piston…
[/quote]
To get the piston to push in the wall, you would need to stand where the wall would be, so the piston would be facing it.
This could be flawed if u placed a block infront of the piston to move the 2nd one in, however, it would fail if they have a couple blocks outside of their region protected (over 13)[/quote]
then that would be a none raidable wall… but… not everyone has 13extra walls…

Read full topic
item.source: RAIDING (if new plugin is installed) (added a better example)

item.title: RAIDING (if new plugin is installed) (added a better example)
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“mironic, post:39, topic:402013”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=499067.msg3652635#msg3652635 date=1309828771]

How about we all just end the discussion and get back on topic?

OT: I don’t think pistons would be allowed to push blocks, if they where that would be a major flaw.

excatly, unless there is a plugin that can disable pistons then that would be the only way… but to get pistons you would have to play the game awhile… or just ask a friend lolz

I think Tom is saying that if Residence plugin was set to not allow other users to edit blocks, it wouldn’t allow other user’s pistons to edit blocks either.

naw, the pistons code is not editing though its moving/pushing. aka temp gravity. (looked at the code… its pretty lazy…)
when the stick pistion retracts it just reverses gravity. thats why they dont have there sticky property when there retracted there not actually sticky but gravity modifiers for that block…

You would never be able to place the piston there without mining out that spot, so this entire method is completely unusable.
[/quote]
? da fuck ? you talking about? O-o yes you would… you dont need to mine a spot to place a piston…[/quote]
To get the piston to push in the wall, you would need to stand where the wall would be, so the piston would be facing it.
This could be flawed if u placed a block infront of the piston to move the 2nd one in, however, it would fail if they have a couple blocks outside of their region protected (over 13)

Read full topic

How about we all just end the discussion and get back on topic?

OT: I don’t think pistons would be allowed to push blocks, if they where that would be a major flaw.

excatly, unless there is a plugin that can disable pistons then that would be the only way… but to get pistons you would have to play the game awhile… or just ask a friend lolz

I think Tom is saying that if Residence plugin was set to not allow other users to edit blocks, it wouldn’t allow other user’s pistons to edit blocks either.

naw, the pistons code is not editing though its moving/pushing. aka temp gravity. (looked at the code… its pretty lazy…)
when the stick pistion retracts it just reverses gravity. thats why they dont have there sticky property when there retracted there not actually sticky but gravity modifiers for that block…
[/quote]
You would never be able to place the piston there without mining out that spot, so this entire method is completely unusable.[/quote]
? da fuck ? you talking about? O-o yes you would… you dont need to mine a spot to place a piston…

Read full topic

item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“mironic, post:37, topic:402013”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=499067.msg3652540#msg3652540 date=1309824284]

How about we all just end the discussion and get back on topic?

OT: I don’t think pistons would be allowed to push blocks, if they where that would be a major flaw.

excatly, unless there is a plugin that can disable pistons then that would be the only way… but to get pistons you would have to play the game awhile… or just ask a friend lolz

I think Tom is saying that if Residence plugin was set to not allow other users to edit blocks, it wouldn’t allow other user’s pistons to edit blocks either.
[/quote]
naw, the pistons code is not editing though its moving/pushing. aka temp gravity. (looked at the code… its pretty lazy…)
when the stick pistion retracts it just reverses gravity. thats why they dont have there sticky property when there retracted there not actually sticky but gravity modifiers for that block…[/quote]
You would never be able to place the piston there without mining out that spot, so this entire method is completely unusable.

item.title: RAIDING (if new plugin is installed) (added a better example)
item.dc:creator: @PLayRooney PLayRooney
item.description:
@PLayRooney wrote:

[quote=“mironic, post:31, topic:402013”][quote author=LilXCj link=topic=499067.msg3652174#msg3652174 date=1309808755]

same with scaling in… good luck getting out.

Terrorism doesn’t require survival.

Ill just pickup the items you drop when you hopelessly fire yourself into bits entering my compound >=D

I’ll bring flint & steel, kill you with a steel sword, take stuff, kill myself in the fire, the items burn and so do I.

I hope you know that this is more griefing than “raiding”.

its just showing how to get inside city walls lol

I’m talking to reyx, not you.

sorry~ you did not have to be so rude. lol

I’m not being rude. I’m just saying I was talking to reyx.

you typed it very rudely XD

its like

Im talking to rex(PERIOD) not you(PERIOD)

me: o.o…

Using punctuation is being rude? Haha.

Anyway, as far as the “idea” goes. I would assume it’d be griefing if you don’t replace them and if the person you raid sees you in action, you’re in deep.
[/quote]
uneeded punctuation[/quote]
How is punctuation ‘Unneeded?’
it is good to use punctuation as much as you can.

Read full topic
